application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1	Common Horse chestnut	  Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2 metres. Remove x1 large low limb as indicated in photo. 	 - currently 13-14m in height and 8-9m width - Finishing height 12.5m height and 7.5-8m widthT2	London Plane	Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2 metres. Reduce crown to previous points of reduction with particular attention on canopy growing towards clients building and building directly opposite. Carry out a full crown inspection and record and report findings to client. Remove deadwood <25mm diameter. - currently 24m in height and 23m width - finishing height 22m and 21m in widthT3	Common Horse Chestnut	Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2 metres. Remove significant deadwood <25mm diameter throughout crown. Raise / lift crown to 5m above ground level. Thin lower crown to ensure even crown density. 	 - currently 24m in height and 20m width - finishing height 22.5m and 18.5m widthT4	Common Horse Chestnut	Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2 metres. - currently 8m in height and 8m width - finishing width 6.5-7m
